sen.j: 伊予親王（いよしんのう・伊豫親王、生年不詳 - 大同 (日本)2年11月12日 (旧暦)（807年12月18日））は、桓武天皇の第3皇子（異説あり）といわれた。
sen.e: The story that Imperial Prince Iyo (?-December 18th, 807) was the third Imperial Prince of Emperor Kanmu is widely believed, but there is also a different story.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The story that Imperial Prince Iyo (? - December 18, 807) was the third Imperial Prince of Emperor Kanmu is widely believed, but there is also a different story.
sen.cmt: space
sen.e: Imperial Prince Iyo (? - December 18, 807) is believed to be the third Imperial Prince of Emperor Kanmu, but there are different theories.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 母は藤原南家藤原是公の娘藤原吉子。
sen.e: His mother was FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Korekimi belonged to the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His mother was FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Korekimi, who belonged to the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: His mother was FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Korekimi, who belonged to the Southern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: 806年（大同元年）、中務卿兼大宰帥に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was appointed to the Nakatsukasa-kyo (Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and Dazai no sochi (Director of Dazaifu (Kyushu branch government)) in 806.
He was appointed as the Nakatsukasa-kyo (Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and Dazai no sochi (Director of Dazaifu (Kyushu branch government)) in 806.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: He was appointed as the Nakatsukasa-kyo (Minister of the Ministry of Central Affairs) and Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu offices (local government office in Kyushu region)) in 806.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: しかし、翌807年（大同2年）、反逆の首謀者であるとして母藤原吉子とともに川原寺（弘福寺）に幽閉された。
sen.e: However, he was confined to the Kawara-dera Temple (also called Gufuku-ji Temple) with his mother FUJIWARA no Yoshiko on the suspicion of being a mastermind of a rebellion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, he was confined to Kawara-dera Temple (also called Gufuku-ji Temple) with his mother, FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, on the suspicion of being the mastermind of a rebellion.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: However, in the following year, 807, he was confined in Kawara-dera Temple (or Gufuku-ji Temple) with his mother, FUJIWARA no Yoshiko, on the suspicion of being the mastermind of a rebellion.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.j: そして絶食した後毒を飲んで自害した。
sen.e: He killed himself by taking poison after fasting.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He killed himself by taking poison after fasting.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 異母兄平城天皇の側近であった藤原式家・藤原仲成に操られた藤原宗成に失脚させられたものとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that he fell from power due to a scheme plotted by FUJIWARA no Munenari, who was manipulated by FUJIWARA no Nakanari belonged to the Fujiwara Shikike (a sub branch of Fujiwara clan), a close retainer of Emperor Heizei who was the half elder brother with the same father of Imperial Prince Iyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is believed that he fell from power due to a scheme plotted by FUJIWARA no Munenari, who was manipulated by FUJIWARA no Nakanari of the Fujiwara Shikike (a sub-branch of the Fujiwara clan), a close retainer of Emperor Heizei, who was the older half-brother (by the same father) of Imperial Prince Iyo.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: It is believed that he fell from power due to a scheme plotted by FUJIWARA no Munenari, who was manipulated by FUJIWARA no Nakanari of the Ceremonial House of the Fujiwara clan, a close advisor of Emperor Heizei who was the older half-brother (by the same father) of Imperial Prince Iyo.
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.e: This is called "Iyo Shinno no Hen (Conspiracy of Iyo Imperial Prince)".

sen.cmt: ダブルクォーテーションの位置を変えました。

sen.j: 後に親王の無実が判明し、839年に一品が追贈された。
sen.e: As the Imperial Prince's innocence was proved afterward, he was given a posthumous rank of Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince) in 839.
The Imperial Prince's innocence was proved, and ultimately, in 839, he was given the posthumous rank of Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince).
sen.cmt: article
sen.e: Later, the Imperial Prince's innocence was proved, and ultimately, in 839, he was given the posthumous rank of Ippon (First Order of an Imperial Prince).
sen.cmt: 「後に」を補足しました。

sen.j: 伊予親王には3人の王子女があったが、親王が自害した後、いずれも遠流となっていた。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Iyo had three children (prince and princess), who were all banished after the suicide of the Imperial Prince.
Imperial Prince Iyo had three children (a prince and two princesses), all of whom were banished after the suicide of the Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: grammar [ASSUMING ONE PRINCE AND TWO PRINCESSES]
sen.e: Imperial Prince Iyo had three children, all of whom were banished to be exiled to the farthest distant island after the suicide of the Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: 「(a prince and two princesses)」を除き、「遠流」の訳を補足しました。

sen.j: その後親王の無実が判明すると、嵯峨天皇により平安京に呼び戻され、没収されていた親王の資産も王子女に返還された。
sen.e: After the Imperial Prince's innocence was proved, Emperor Saga called back those children to Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto) and also returned them the property of the Imperial Prince.

Once the Imperial Prince's innocence had been proved, Emperor Saga called the children back to Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in the current Kyoto) and returned to them the property of the Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: grammar
sen.e: Once the Imperial Prince's innocence had been proved later, Emperor Saga called the children back to Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in the current Kyoto) and returned to them the property of the Imperial Prince.
sen.cmt: 「その後」を補足しました。

sen.j: このうち第2王子の高枝王（802年(延暦21)～858年(天安2)）は826年(天長3)に従四位下に直叙された後、因幡国や大舍人頭を務めた。
sen.e: Having been granted the Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 826, the second prince Takae (802-858) served as the Inaba no kokushi (the governor of Inaba Province) and the Otoneri-no-kami (Director of the Bureau of Royal Attendants).
sen.cmt: 因幡国や大舎人頭を務め，の意味が不明ですので因幡国司としました。一原文一訳文の例外対処。

sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After being granted Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) in 826, the second prince Takae (802-858) served as the Inaba no kami (Governor of Inaba Province) and Otoneri-no-kami (Director of the Bureau of Royal Attendants).
sen.cmt: FBに基づき修正しました。

sen.e: He was also promoted to the Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) in 854.

sen.j: 更に大蔵省律令制における大蔵省・宮内省などを歴任した。
sen.e: In addition, he successively assumed the posts of the Minister of Finance and the Minister of the Imperial Household in the Ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).
sen.cmt: 省を歴任するという意味がわかりません。大蔵卿 宮内卿と訳しました。

sen.j: 伊予国の伊予橘氏や越智氏の祖とされる藤原為世(浮穴四郎)は伊予親王の子である。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tameyo (also called Shiro UKENA), who is believed as the founder of the Iyo Tachibana clan in Iyo Province and the Ochi clan, was a child of Imperial Prince Iyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tameyo (also called Shiro UKENA), who is believed to have founded the Iyo Tachibana clan in Iyo Province as well as the Ochi clan, was a child of Imperial Prince Iyo.

sen.e: FUJIWARA no Tameyo (or Shiro UKENA), who was believed to have founded the Iyo Tachibana clan in Iyo Province as well as the Ochi clan, was a child of Imperial Prince Iyo.

sen.j: 嵯峨天皇が勅して皇子に準じられ、藤原の姓を受けた、という説がある。
sen.e: It is also believed that he was treated as a prince on Emperor Saga's instructions and bestowed the Fujiwara's family name.
